decoworld.model.world.combat.stats

Class Stat

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoworld.model.world.combat.stats.Stat

  • public class Stat
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a generic statistic.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Stat(double max, double percentage, StatType type, HasStats parent) 
      Stat(double max, StatType type, HasStats parent)
      Creates a new statistic and sets the initial percentage of the maximum value remaining to 1.0.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stat

        public Stat(double max,
    StatType type,
    HasStats parent)
        Creates a new statistic and sets the initial percentage of the maximum value remaining to 1.0.
        Parameters:
        max - - the maximum value for this statistic
        type - - the type of statistic
        parent - - the parent object to which this stat applies

        Parameters:

        percentage - - the initial percentage of the maximum value remaining

    • Method Detail

      • onTick

        public void onTick(double tick)
        This method should be called for every world step.
        Parameters:
        tick - - the time since the last world step

      • applyEffect

        public boolean applyEffect(StatEffect effect)
        Applies any applicable statistic effects. This method should only be called by the parent HasStats to which this Stat applies.
        Returns:
        boolean - true iff the effect was applied.

      • setPercentage

        public void setPercentage(double percentage)
        Sets the remaining percentage value of the statistic. Percentages must be greater than or equal to 0.0. Percentages above 1.0 represent temporary boosts above the maximum value. It is recommended that you use the applyEffect method instead. This statistic may modify effects to deal with bonuses or resistances.
        Parameters:
        percentage - - the remaining percentage value

      • setMaxValue

        public void setMaxValue(double max)
        Sets the 'maximum' value of the statistic. The maximum value must be greater than or equal to 0.0. It is possible to go over the maximum value by setting the stat percentage to a value greater than 1.0. Percentages above 1.0 represent temporary boosts above the maximum value.
        Parameters:
        max - - the maximum value of the statistic

      • getPercentage

        public double getPercentage()
        Returns the remaining percentage value of the statistic. Percentages must be greater than or equal to 0.0. Percentages above 1.0 represent temporary boosts above the maximum value.
        Returns:
        double - the remaining value of the statistic

      • getMaxValue

        public double getMaxValue()
        Returns the 'maximum' value of the statistic. The maximum value must be greater than or equal to 0.0. It is possible to go over the maximum value by setting the stat percentage to a value greater than 1.0. Percentages above 1.0 represent temporary boosts above the maximum value.
        Returns:
        double - the maximum value of the statistic

      • getType

        public StatType getType()
        Returns the type of the statistic. See StatType for a list of supported types.
        Returns:
        type - the type of statistic
